title: Part A
stimulusHtml: One point is earned for stating that diminishing returns does not set in with the second worker because the marginal product, MP, is increasing (MP of the first worker is 60 and the MP of the second worker is 80).
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

One point is earned for stating that diminishing returns does not set in with the second worker because the marginal product, MP, is increasing (MP of the first worker is 60 and the MP of the second worker is 80).

The student earns all of the following points:

One point is earned for stating that diminishing returns does not set in with the second worker because the marginal product, MP, is increasing (MP of the first worker is 60 and the MP of the second worker is 80).

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: One point is earned for calculating the AFC = $500 รท 250 = $2.
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

The student earns all of the following points:

One point is earned for calculating the AFC = $500 รท 250 = $2.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: One point is earned for stating that the profit-maximizing number of workers is 5. The MRP of the fifth worker is $240 > the wage rate $200. For the sixth worker, the MRP is $80 < the wage rate of $200.
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

One point is earned for stating that the profit-maximizing number of workers is 5. The MRP of the fifth worker is $240 > the wage rate $200. For the sixth worker, the MRP is $80 < the wage rate of $200.

The student earns all of the following points:

One point is earned for stating that the profit-maximizing number of workers is 5. The MRP of the fifth worker is $240 > the wage rate $200. For the sixth worker, the MRP is $80 < the wage rate of $200.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: One point is earned for stating that the number of workers hired will be less than the number of workers in part (c), because the decrease in the price of peas decreases the marginal revenue product of labor (MRP).
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

One point is earned for stating that the number of workers hired will be less than the number of workers in part (c), because the decrease in the price of peas decreases the marginal revenue product of labor (MRP).

The student earns all of the following points:

One point is earned for stating that the number of workers hired will be less than the number of workers in part (c), because the decrease in the price of peas decreases the marginal revenue product of labor (MRP).

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: One point is earned for stating that the wage will be lower.
descriptions:

The student earns all of the following points:
